chunks.en: Shenzhen will start issuing tickets for carrying passengers on electric bicycles?
I was stopped by the traffic police this morning, who said that carrying a person exceeded 1.2m and issued a ticket.
Currently, I haven't found the basis for this specific regulation.
I would rather they strictly manage and then promote the amendment and improvement of regulations, rather than being ambiguous.
I don't know what it is now. They say no passengers are allowed, but there are electric bikes carrying passengers everywhere.
They say electric bikes can only use non-motor vehicle lanes, but no one cares about motor vehicles illegally parked in non-motor vehicle lanes.
Pedestrians are even worse, with no right of way at all.
The worst off are the honest people.
'There is a law to abide by, and the law must be strictly enforced' has become a joke.
What about those who solicit passengers?
@hailaz Walking in Shenzhen now is the worst, very nerve-wracking
You'll know this rule once you take the theory test.
Adults driving bicycles or electric bicycles can carry one child under the age of 12 on urban roads, provided it is safe. Carrying passengers on other roads is limited to one person.
Xi'an also fines for carrying passengers, 20 yuan.
Electric bicycles cannot carry people over 12 years old, and motorcycles cannot carry minors.
Many cities across the country actually had similar regulations a long time ago. I always felt that enforcement was selective and not strict.

Articles 37 and 55 of the Guangdong Province Road Safety Regulations. https://www.gd.gov.cn/zwgk/wjk/zcfgk/content/post_2531572.html Article 37: Bicycles and electric bicycles are not allowed to carry passengers on urban roads, but if a fixed safety seat is installed, they can carry a child under 1.2 meters in height. Carrying passengers on other roads is limited to one person. Article 55: ... Non-motor vehicle drivers who violate road traffic safety laws, administrative regulations, and these regulations regarding road traffic rules shall be given a warning or a fine of 20 yuan; however, for any of the following behaviors, they shall be ordered to make corrections and given a warning or a fine of 50 yuan: ... (3) Violating the regulations by carrying passengers or driving at a speed exceeding 15 kilometers per hour;)
Hasn't it always been fined? We started fining people for carrying other people in 2018.
In Hangzhou, electric bicycles (including bicycles) carrying people over 12 years old have always been caught and fined.
Sigh, I envy Shenzhen more, where you can legally ride electric bikes.

In Xiamen Island, electric vehicles cannot be licensed or ridden, they are in a gray area, they can catch you if they want to, and if they don't want to, they won't catch you, which makes me afraid to buy an electric vehicle.
@qoo2019 I recently found out that the traffic police don't even care about helmets for electric donkeys without license plates.
@xscc It seems that licensing is just to manage honest people.
